srch_SelectColumns_grpBasics: Data Elements or Indicators Groups - Basics
object_type_help: Defines the data type of the specific data element  or indicator used in the form.
object_name_help: Defines the name of the data element or indicator assigned/used in a dataset.
object_form_help: Defines the form name in the section form.(Applicable to Data Elements only).
object_id_help: Defines the unique ID of the data element or indicator used in the form.
object_code_help: Defines the unique code assigned to the data element or indicator in the form.
object_ICD10_help: Defines the unique ICD10 Code assigned to the specified data element or indicator in the form.
object_description_help: Defines the description of the Data Element or Indicator used in a form.
object_num_formula_help: Defines a description of the numerator formula used in an Indicator. Applicable for Indicators.
object_den_formula_help: Defines a description of the denominator formula used in an Indicator. Applicable for Indicators.
objectGroup_name_help: Defines the name of the data element or indicator groups assigned or used in a dataset.
objectGroup_id_help: Defines the unique ID of the data element or indicator group used in a dataset.
objectGroup_code_help: Defines the unique code assigned to the data element or indicator group used in a dataset.
service_name_help: Defines the name of the Service assigned to the dataset.
service_id_help: Defines the unique service ID of the data element or indicator used in a dataset.
service_code_help: Defines the unique service code assigned to the data element or indicator group used in a dataset.
srch_Help_Text:
This interface is made to simplify user access the terminology associated with information collected with HMIS.

  • Via the Search tab, you can directly search for a term in all the columns of the table. You can display column filters as well, which allow you to search for information in one specific column. Use 'Clear filters' to reset all the filters. Expert users can use the key word '|' (OR) to search multiple objects.
  • Via the Manage Columns tab, you can select columns to be displayed in the table. Expert users can use the advanced columns to perform detailed researches via IDs.
You can finally export the results of your search to Excel (page by page, and do not forget to save as .xls).
invalid_user_group: All UID's must be a valid userGroup
program_description_help: Defines a description of the Health Program used in HMIS.
programs_tei_name_help: Defines the name of the tracked entity attribute for the patients data collected an entry form.
programs_tei_formName_help: Defines the form name of the tracked entity attribute for the patient's data collected an entry form.
programs_tei_description_help: Defines a description of the tracked entity attribute for the patients data collected in an entry form.
programs_tei_valueType_help: Defines a data value type of the tracked entity attribute for the patients data collected in an entry form.
programs_tei_aggregationType_help: Defines a data aggregation type of the tracked entity attribute for the patients data collected in an entry form.
programs_tei_mandatory_help: Defines a boolean expression of whether the tracked entity attribute should be visible or not used in an entry form.
programs_tei_visbility_help: Defines a boolean expression of whether the attribute should be mandatory or not used in an entry form.
programs_tei_optionSet_help: Defines the option set of the tracked entity attribute data assigned used in an entry form.
programs_ps_name_help: Defines the name of the data element of a program in HMIS.
programs_ps_formName_help: Defines the name of the form used in a program stage in HMIS.
programs_ps_description_help: Defines a description of the stage of a program in HMIS.
programs_ps_valueType_help: Defines the type of data to be collected in a stage of a program in HMIS.
programs_ps_calculationMode_help: Defines the mode of calculation of the data values to be collected in a stage of a program in HMIS.
programs_ps_mandatory_help: Defines a boolean expression of whether the program stage should be mandatory in an entry form.
programs_ps_visbility_help: Defines a boolean expression of whether the attribute should be mandatory or not used in an entry form.
programs_ps_optionSet_help: Defines the option set of the tracked entity attribute data assigned used in an entry form.
programs_pi_name_help: Defines the name of the program indicator used in a program in HMIS.
programs_pi_description_help: Defines a description of the program indicator used in a program in HMIS.
programs_pi_filter_help: Defines a filter of the program indicator used in a program in HMIS.
programs_pi_calculation_help: Defines the calculation mode of the program indicator in a program in HMIS.
programs_pi_aggregationType_help: Defines an aggregation type of the program indicator used in a program in HMIS.
programs_pi_type_help: Defines the type of program indicator used in a program in HMIS.
programs_pi_stagesReferenced_help: Defines the stages of a Program that the program indicator is set  for data calculation in a program in HMIS.

programs_pi_visualization_help: Displays the data visualization set for the program indicator following a calculation in a program in HMIS.
programs_i_name_help: Defines the name of an indicator used in a program in HMIS.
programs_i_description_help: Defines a description of an indicator used in a program in HMIS.
programs_i_type_help: Defines a type of the data value calculated by an indicator used in a program in HMIS.
programs_i_numerator_help: Defines the title of the Indicator numerator for the value the indicator calculates.
programs_i_denominator_help: Defines the title of the Indicator denominator for what the indicator calculates.
programs_i_stagesReferenced_help: Defines the stages of a program that the Indicator is set  for data calculation in a program in HMIS.
programs_i_visualization_help: Displays the data visualization set for the Indicator following a calculation in a program in HMIS.
programs_pr_name_help: Defines the name of the program rules configured for a program in HMIS.
programs_pr_description_help: Defines a description of the program rules configured for a program in HMIS.

programs_pr_denominator_help: Defines a title of the denominator for a program rule configured for a program in HMIS.

programs_prv_sourceType_help: Defines a source type for a program rule variable configured for a program in HMIS.

datasets_ind_name_help: Defines the name of the indicator assigned/used in a dataset.
datasets_ind_type_help: Defines the type of value that is resulted from the calculation of the indicator based on the calculation fomula.
datasets_ind_numerator_help: Defines the title of the indicator numerator based on what result the indicator calculates.
datasets_ind_numeratorDescription_help: Defines a description of the indicator numerator based on what result the indicator calculates.
datasets_ind_denominator_help: Defines the title of the indicator denominator based on what result the indicator calculates.
datasets_ind_denominatorDescription_help: Defines a description of the indicator numerator based on what result the indicator calculates.
indicators_description_help: A set of mathematical operations that is used to calculate rates, incidences and other values that are a result of data element values that have been entered into the system.
indicators_num_type_help: Indicator types define the factor that is applied during aggregation.
indicators_num_name_help: Defines the title of the indicator numerator based on what the indicator calculates
indicators_num_dataSets_help: Denotes the respective dataset with which the indicator belongs to.
indicators_num_program_help: Denotes the specific program with which the indicator belongs to.
indicators_den_type_help: Indicator types define the factor that is applied during aggregation.
indicators_den_name_help: Defines the title of the Indicator Denominator based on what the indicator calculates
indicators_den_dataSets_help: Denotes the respective dataset with which the indicator belongs to.
indicators_den_program_help: Denotes the specific program with which the indicator belongs to.
